sen.e: The Oie-ryu style was the basic calligraphy style for oraimono (textbooks of letter format) used in terakoya, which is a private school for children of commoner citizens; and as people became enthusiastic over the style also became widespread.

In response to the growing interest of education, the Oie School explosively spread as it was used in the textbooks for common citizens, such as oraimono (textbooks of letter format), in terakoya (temple elementary school) in the Edo period.
